quote: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.ù
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A person's a person, no matter how small.ù
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.ù
author: Socrates

quote: Perhaps one did not want to be loved so much as to be understood.ù
author: George Orwell

quote: Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.ù
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When adults say, "Teenagers think they are invincible" with that sly, stupid smile on their faces, they don't know how right they are. We need never be hopeless, because we can never be irreparably broken. We think that we are invincible because we are. We cannot be born, and we cannot die. Like all energy, we can only change shapes and sizes and manifestations. They forget that when they get old. They get scared of losing and failing. But that part of us greater than the sum of our parts cannot begin and cannot end, and so it cannot fail.ù
author: John Green

quote: I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity.ù
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The one you love and the one who loves you are never, ever the same person.ù
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Be careful about reading health books. Some fine day you'll die of a misprint.ù
author: Markus Herz

quote: Have you ever noticed how ÀúWhat the hell is always the right decision to make?ù
author: Terry Johnson

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.ù
author: Charles W. Eliot

quote: You can't live your life for other people. You've got to do what's right for you, even if it hurts some people you love.ù
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: If you're gonna be two-faced at least make one of them pretty.ù
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing.ù
author: Harper Lee

quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.ù
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.ù
author: Helen Keller

quote: So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was a hurricane.ù
author: John Green

quote: Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silentù
author: Victor hugo

quote: I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university.ù
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading.ù
author: William Styron
